required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MRI DWI None-Gaussian Model Predicting Early Response to Immunotherapy in Digestive System Malignancies: a Prospective Observational Study
clinical_study.official_title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Diffusion-weighted Imaging (Dwi) None-Gaussian Model Predicting Early Response to Immunotherapy in Digestive System Malignancies: a Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective two cohorts observational study aimed to investigate the predicting value of MRI none-Gaussian model in digestive malignancies patients who received single agent PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor or combined immunotherapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment of the first subject until the database cut-off approximately 12 months later.
primary_outcome.description: The rate of patients reached complete response or partial response.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment of the first subject until the database cut-off approximately 12 months later.
secondary_outcome.description: the time from enrollment to disease progression or death or loss of follow-up.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment of the first subject until the database cut-off approximately 12 months later.
secondary_outcome.description: the time from enrollment to death or loss of follow-up.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive single agent PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor in a predefined group.
Patients will receive combined immunotherapy in a predefined group. PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor will be combined with target therapy, such as lenvatinib, enrotinib, herceptin et al.

intervention.description: Patients will receive diagnostic MRI test on d0.
Patients will receive diagnostic MRI test on d8±1.
Patients will receive diagnostic MRI test on d30±2.

study_pop.textblock: Patients receive treatment in Beijing Cancer Hospital.
